snippet: A private bond offering by Dewey & LeBoeuf in 2010 did not disclose the extensive guarantees that it gave to partners, an omission that could subject the law firm to litigation, securities lawyers say.
abstract: A private bond offering by Dewey & LeBoeuf in 2010 did not disclose the extensive guarantees that it gave to partners, an omission that could subject the law firm to litigation, securities lawyers say.

headline.main: A Dewey Bond Offering Made No Mention of Partner Guarantees
headline.print_headline: Dewey’s Omission of Partner Guarantees in a Bond Sale Could Lead to Litigation
